I cannot speak to whether or not most mainstream literature and music in catalonia is biased towards catalan independence, but i can recommend a work that offers a different perspective on the political situation in catalonia.

one example is the novel "patria" by spanish author fernando aramburu. although aramburu is not catalan, the novel takes place in the basque region of spain and explores similar themes of national identity, politics, and violence. the novel offers a nuanced and complex portrayal of the conflict between the spanish state and basque separatists, and it presents a range of perspectives on the issue, including both pro- and anti-separatist viewpoints. while the novel is not explicitly about catalonia, the issues it addresses are similar to those facing catalonia, and it offers a different perspective on the issue of nationalism and separatism in spain.

while it is possible that there are other works that offer a pro-spanish perspective on the political situation in catalonia, it is worth noting that such perspectives may be less prevalent in mainstream literature and music in the region. nonetheless, there are many independent outlets for literature and music in catalonia, and it is possible that such perspectives may be represented in these spaces.
